page.title: 02A dairy farm
page.content: Slyes farm is a dairy farm of about 160 acres with 80 cows.The owner's father started the farm by purchasing 18 acres of land slightly higher than pevensey Levels. The farm fronts onto a minor road but behind the buildings the land falls steeply away to Pevensey Levels where most of the farms 160 acres lie. There are 2 employee cowmen.The herd is milked twice daily at 5am and 3pm.Daily yield is approximatily 240 gallons which is stored in a 400 gallon tank whilst awaiting collection by the Milk Marketing Board agent. Although the owner doesn't want to give up his diary herd,E.E.C.quotas arecutting his earnings.And these regulations would prevent the resumption of diary farming at a later date.
